definition: Songhay people of Mali and the Sahara
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
(literary) not ended/not yet over/close to the end
Weiyang District of Xi’an 西安市[Xi1 an1 Shi4], Shaanxi
a raft made of bamboo or wood/to fell trees/to hew
floating between zither and sword (idiom); fig. wandering aimlessly with no tenured position
to sing to a string accompaniment/education (a reference to teaching the people Confucian values by means of song in ancient times)
free of worldly concerns/above the fray/at peace with the world
the world of mortals (Buddhism)/human society/worldly affairs
lit. boat made of lily magnolia wood/poetic term for boat
youngest brother/a period of two or three months
